node.name: MMBase
node.intro: This is release fixes a problem discoverd shortly after MMBase-1.6.4 was released. MMBase-1.6.4 contains a wrong class wich may result in rather confusing output of some queries. Check out the releasenotes for more information.

node.body:
MMBase is distributed in two different 'flavours', mmbase-src and mmbase. First is the source distribution and the second is the binary distribution.
The binary distribution's target users are end-users and first-time users. It contains a working hsqldb database and applications (including builders) needed for the examples can be installed.
The source distribution's target users are developers who like to start building their own MMBase.
The final release can be downloaded from <http://www.mmbase.org/download>. This page will be updated somewhere tomorrow (friday), untill then you can download it from <http://www.mmbase.org/releases/>
The MMBase releaseteam (thanks everybody who made this release possible)
node.name: MMBase
node.intro:
The MMBase developers team is proud to present the final Release of MMBase-1.6.0.
Highlights are:
- Editwizards - Documentation - Scan turned off - Builders can use inheritance (experimental) - Automatic builder installation for applications - a lot of bugfixes - and more and more
For more new features/bugfixes/etc see releasenotes inside the zip.

node.body:
MMBase is distributed in two different 'flavours', mmbase-src and mmbase. First is the source distribution and the second is the binary distribution.
The binary distribution's target users are end-users and first-time users. It contains a working hsqldb database and applications (including builders) needed for the examples can be installed.
The source distribution's target users are developers who like to start building their own MMBase.
The release can be downloaded from <http://www.mmbase.org/download>.
The MMBase releaseteam (thanks everybody who made this release possible)
node.name: MMBase
node.intro:
The MMBase developers team is proud to present the Release of MMBase-1.6.1.
MMBase-1.6.1 is the first bugfix release and it'll not be the last one :) . We're going to try to release a bugfix release every month. Besides the monthly official release, there will be a weekly build on saterday night. This weekly build can be downloaded from the nightly builds page <http://www.mmbase.org/download/builds/>.
For information about fixed bugs see releasenotes inside the zip.

node.body:
MMBase-1.6.2 is the second bugfix release and fixes a few important performance bugs (ie. MMObjectNode::getRelated(type) fix and select *from fix). It also contains a new version of TypeRel which has better support for inheritance and has been cleaned.
For more information about fixed bugs see releasenotes inside the zip.
MMBase is distributed in two different 'flavours', mmbase-src and mmbase. First is the source distribution and the second is the binary distribution.
The binary distribution's target users are end-users and first-time users. It contains a working hsqldb database and applications (including builders) needed for the examples can be installed.
The source distribution's target users are developers who like to start building their own MMBase.
The release can be downloaded in the download section.
At last the release team wants to thank everybody who made this release possible.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro:
The MMBase developers team is proud to present the second release of the stable MMBase 1.6, called MMBase-1.6.2
In this new release more bugs are fixed, and some important performance issues have been solved.

node.name: MMBase
node.intro: MMBase-1.6.3 is another bugfix release and fixes a few important bugs which caused a few problems in the previous release.

node.body:
MBase-1.6.4 is another bugfix release, see the releasenotes for an allmost complete list of changes.
A lot of the changes are related to the edittools: - editwizards: better performance - jsp-editors: few extra functions (eg create new node while creating relation) - my_editors: better useability and a few extra functions
There are still a few known issues in this release, some of which will be fixed in the next major release (1.7.0), see releasenotes for more information.
MMBase is distributed in three different 'flavours', mmbase-src, mmbase-bin and mmbase-bin for jdk1.4. First is the source distribution, the second is the binary distribution for jdk-1.3.x users and the third is the binary distribution for jdk-1.4.x users. The last one is necessary because of rmi incompatibilities between jdk-1.3.x and jdk-1.4.x.
The binary distribution's target users are end-users and first-time users. It contains a working hsqldb database and applications (including builders) needed for the examples.
The source distribution's target users are developers who like to start building their own MMBase.
The release can be downloaded from <http://www.mmbase.org/download>.
The MMBase releaseteam (thanks to everybody who made this release possible)
node.name: MMBase
node.intro:
MMBase-1.6.4 is another bugfix release, see the releasenotes for an almost complete list of changes.
The MMBase releaseteam thanks everybody who made this release possible

node.body: This rc can be used to test the next release. Please help us by testing it and send your test results to the mmbase developers mailinglist. If you find bugs, please report them in the bugtracker.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro:
This is the first release candidate of the next major MMBase release.
Information about changes between MMBase-1.6.x and MMBase-1.7.0 is included in the releasenotes (though it's not complete yet).

node.body:
There are a lot of bugs fixed between rc1 and rc2. Pdf version of most documentation is included.
New with this release are the applications that are not part of the distro, these can be downloaded also.
Information about changes between MMBase-1.6.x and MMBase-1.7.0 is included in the releasenotes.
This rc can be used to test the next release. Please help us by testing it and send your test results to the mmbase developers mailinglist. If you find bugs, please report them in the bugtracker.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: This is the second release candidate of the next major MMBase release.

node.body:
This will be the last release candidate if no showstopers are found during the next week. The final release will be available next monday.
There are a lot of bugs fixed between rc2 and rc3.
There are also release candidates available for the applications that are not part of the distro: Cloudcontextsecurity, media, email and scan.
Information about changes between MMBase-1.6.x and MMBase-1.7.0 is included in the releasenotes.
This rc can be used to test the next release. Please help us by testing it and send your test results to the mmbase developers mailinglist. If you find bugs, please report them in the bugtracker.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: This is the third release candidate of the next major MMBase release.

node.body:
This is the first release in which a lot of functionality has been seperated from the core and put into applications. This process will continue after this release. The core will become smaller and MMBase wil become more modular.
Other highlights are:
- completely rewritten storage layer - new query framework - media application - a lot of new taglib features (see documentation for more info)
For more new features/bugfixes/etc see releasenotes inside the zip.
Because a lot of bugs have been fixed since the previous release, you are advised to upgrade your existing installations. Please refer to the upgrade.txt file for information.
MMBase is distributed in two different 'flavours', mmbase-src and mmbase. First is the source distribution and the second is the binary distribution.
The binary distribution's target users are end-users and first-time users. It contains a working hsqldb database and applications (including builders) needed for the examples can be installed.
The source distribution's target users are developers who like to start building their own MMBase.
Thanks to everybody who made this release possible.
The MMBase releaseteam
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: The MMBase developers team is proud to present the long awaited final Release of MMBase-1.7.0 (only a few days after MMBase, as an open source project, turned 4, 3 april).

node.body:
There are a lot of bugs fixed in this release, see releasenotes.txt for more information about the bugs that are fixed.
Because of the amount of bugs that have been fixed since the previous release, you are advised to upgrade your existing installations. Please refer to the upgrade.txt file for information.
MMBase is distributed in two different 'flavours', mmbase-src and mmbase. First is the source distribution and the second is the binary distribution.
The binary distribution's target users are end-users and first-time users. It contains a working hsqldb database and applications (including builders) needed for the examples can be installed.
The source distribution's target users are developers who like to start building their own MMBase.
Thanks to everybody who made this release possible.
The MMBase releaseteam
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: The MMBase developers team is proud to present the first bugfix release of MMBase-1.7.

node.body:
More than 30 bugs have been fixed in this release and also a few performance issues have been resolved. See releasenotes.txt for the complete list of bugfixes.
Because an unicast implementation has been added besides the existing multicast implementation for broadcasting changes, you are required to make some configuration changes. Please refer to the upgrade.txt for information about these changes.
MMBase is distributed in two different 'flavours', mmbase-src and mmbase. First is the source distribution and the second is the binary distribution.
The binary distribution's target users are end-users and first-time users. It contains a working hsqldb database and applications (including builders) needed for the examples can be installed.
The source distribution's target users are developers who like to start building their own MMBase.
Thanks to everybody who made this release possible.
The MMBase releaseteam
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: The MMBase developers team is proud to present the second bugfix release of MMBase-1.7.

node.body:
This bug (#6637: Query-caches are not invalidated correctly if queried on relation-object directly) resulted in problems with the editwizards. The 1.7.3 release includes a bugfix for this problem and also includes a few more bugfixes, see releasenotes for more information.
The applications like Cloudcontext Security, Media, Email and Scan weren't updated in this release. The applications from 1.7.2 can be used.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: Just a few days after the 1.7.2 release a rather nasty bug has been found and fixed.

node.body: After quite a long time we have finally released MMBase 1.7.4. It contains numerous bugfixes, and a few new features (most noticably: a few of the new 'imaging' features were backported from 1.8).
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: MMBase 1.7.4 is a bugfix release, with a few new features.

node.body: The first release candidate of the upcoming 1.8 release.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: Release candidate of the upcoming 1.8 release.

node.body: The long anticipated release which packs a lot of new features and applications: optimised and cleaner code, new datatypes, improvements on fields and other functionality's and improvements.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: The MMBase 1.8.0 release

node.body: Bugfixe release of MMBase 1.7. Contains a fix for a nasty bug in the editwizards that prevented them from running on Tomcat 5.5 and Java 1.5 and some other minor fixes.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: Bugfixe release of the former main MMBase release.

node.body: This is a bugfix release, with major improvements on the terrain of performance and memory-use, and some minor other improvements. A more complete overview can be read in the release-notes.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: The first bugfixes release of MMBase 1.8 with some major performance improvements.

node.body: A total of more then 20 bugs were fixed in this release. See the bugtracker for all bugs fixed in this release.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: Second bugfix release of MMBase 1.8.

node.body: The former release was two months ago. Since then several more bugs were fixed, enough to justify a new release.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: Third bugfix release of MMBase 1.8.

node.body: 54 issues were fixed in this version: http://www.mmbase.org/jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&pid=10000&fixfor=10140
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: Bugfix release of MMBase 1.8.

node.body: This release candidate includes fixes for over 50 bugs. Please refer to the release noes for more information: http://www.mmbase.org/development/download/head/stable/MMBase-1_8_5-rc1//release-notes.txt
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: Release candidate for MMBase 1.8.5, for your testing purposes...

node.body: One of the main new features in this release is a javascript framework for the datatypes MMBase supports since 1.8. Using a asynchronous validation library (ajax) you can now validate form field inputs against their datatypes.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: Between rc1 and this release a few more issues were found and fixed.

node.body: Version 1.9 adds functionality for component based development to MMBase. Components that adhere to the component framework standard can be used across different MMBase applications.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: The beta release of the long awaited version with the MMBase Component Framework.

node.body: This release contains a dozen new features and fixes over 50 issues. See the release notes for more information.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: Release candidate for MMBase 1.8.6, for your testing purposes...

node.body: Bugfix release of MMBase 1.8.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: Bugfix release of MMBase 1.8.

node.body: Components are applications or pieces of functionality that can be used in very different MMBase environments like Didactor or CMSC as long as the component framework is implemented. MMBase itself ships with a basic implementation of its framework, all administration pages are now component based and feature an urlfilter to beautify links. Besides all these new features this is the first release build with Maven.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: The MMBase 1.9.0 release that includes the new MMBase Component Framework among a number of other new features.

node.body: This release has been made with Maven 2. The release notes note over 35 improvements and new features like support for H2 databases, views in MySQL and a few dozen bugfixes.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: MMBase 1.9.1 includes several bug fixes and a some new features.

node.body: Release candidate of the soon to be released version 1.9.2.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: Release candidate of the soon to be released version 1.9.2.

node.body: The download of this release is build with Maven though.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: Bugfix release of MMBase 1.8 which still can be build with Ant.

node.body: This release includes 50 bugfixes and some improvements. One of the most notable new features is the new Streams application that encodes uploaded video and audio to other formats with the help of FFmpeg.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: Latest release of MMBase with a ton of new features and bugfixes.

node.body: See the release notes http://www.mmbase.org/jira/browse/MMB/fixforversion/10190 New features include those of search and relate, streams, data types and core.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: Latest bug fix release of MMBase with some new features.

node.body: MMBase-1.9.4 is a bugfix release, containing a few small new features. See the release notes for more details about the 25 issues new, fixed or improved.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: MMBase-1.9.4 is a bugfix release, containing a few small new features. See the release notes for more details about the 25 issues new, fixed or improved.

node.body: Latest release of MMBase 1.9 with bugfixes and some new features.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: Latest release of MMBase 1.9 with bugfixes and some new features.

node.body: Bugfix release with a few new features of the ever steady developing 1.9 branch of MMBase. Check the release notes for new features like automatic video thumbnails in streams, workflow in cloud context security, performance improvements, 25 bug fixes and 16 improvements.
node.name: MMBase
node.intro: Bugfix release with a few new features of the ever steady developing 1.9 branch of MMBase.
